intro: Nicolaia subulicalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leafed nicolaia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
